text: George Richards Minot (December 2, 1885 - February 25, 1950) was an American doctor. He won the 1934 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, along with George Whipple and William P. Murphy, for their discoveries how eating liver could cure anaemia. ==References== Category:1885 births Category:1950 deaths Category:American physicians Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:Scientists from Boston
title: George Minot
